description: We meet up at The Playhouse//Swillburger on the 3rd Saturday of every month. Burgers, arcade games, drinks, and hangouts. It's a good time.
name: ROC Game Dev - Social Meetup

description:
// Spruce and Juice Your Unity Games //
It's a known fact that you can generally pick out a Unity game by it's distinct look. "Spruce and Juice Your Unity Games" will go over quick and simple methods of making your Unity games look less generic, and more beautiful. With simple scripts provided for free from Unity, you can tailor your game's look to your tastes.

This workshop will be led by Noah Ratcliff. Check out Noah's work at http://nratcliff.itch.io/. You can reach Noah on Twitter at: http://twitter.com/20c109

// SCHEDULE //
7-7:15 - Arrivals
7:15-7:30 - Introductions + quick announcements (open to anyone)
7:30-8: Workshop
8-8:30: Project sharing
8:30-10: Networking, general discussion, and hanging out!

// DIRECTIONS //
You can enter campus at the main entrance off of Jefferson Rd or via East River Rd. The building is Student Innovation Hall (SIH on the map) and the parking lot is Lot S. Walk towards the buildings and walk through the Global Village Quad (beautiful outdoor seating area). You will see a round, glass shaped building with vertical MAGIC Center banners - that’s us! Walk up the stairs, through the door and take your immediate (2 more steps) right through another glass door and you are there!

http://maps.rit.edu/

Special thanks to MAGIC for hosting us!
https://www.facebook.com/ritmagic/
name: ROC Game Dev - Workshop + Meetup

description:
We'll be set up at the Rochester Mini Maker Faire this year and it falls on the same day as our social meetup. So we thought we'd combine the two!

Swing by our table, try out some game builds, hang out and chat, and check out the rest of the makers! We can get you discount tickets ($5) but please message me for them ahead of time.

Event: https://www.facebook.com/RochesterMiniMakerFaire/?fref=ts

Hope to see you all there!
name: ROC Game Dev - Social Meetup at Mini Maker Faire!

description:

description:
We're going to pass on having a workshop this month and instead have a night of coworking! Bring your laptop/workstation and set up shop to work on any projects, prototypes, or collab with other members! 

A projector will be available if you'd like to share any progress, ideas, or have others playtest. Come give and get input on your work, share knowledge, and help make awesome games come out of Rochester! 

Feel free to invite any artist or musician friends who would be interested in this meetup.

// SCHEDULE //
7-7:15 - Arrivals
7:15-7:30 - Quick announcements (open to anyone)
7:30-10 - Coworking!

// DIRECTIONS //
You can enter campus at the main entrance off of Jefferson Rd or via East River Rd. The building is Student Innovation Hall (SIH on the map) and the parking lot is Lot S. Walk towards the buildings and walk through the Global Village Quad (beautiful outdoor seating area). You will see a round, glass shaped building with vertical MAGIC Center banners - that’s us! Walk up the stairs, through the door and take your immediate (2 more steps) right through another glass door and you are there!

http://maps.rit.edu/

Special thanks to MAGIC for hosting us!
https://www.facebook.com/ritmagic/

description:
// SCHEDULE //
7-7:15 - Arrivals
7:15-7:30 - Announcements
7:30-8:30 - Workshop
8:30 - 10 - Project / Prototype sharing + discussion

We would love to see more project and prototype sharing! Sharing isn't limited to finished or in-process work. We would love to see old ideas, things that never panned out, or whatever else you've worked on. Feel free to run any questions by me.

// WORKSHOP //
Intro to Streaming on Twitch
Devin Strehle and Pete Lazarski, both regulars of the meetup and from Workinman, will give us a crash course in getting up and running on Twitch. Check out their channels:

Devin - https://www.twitch.tv/strehfox
Pete - https://www.twitch.tv/imaginarymonsters

// DIRECTIONS //
You can enter campus at the main entrance off of Jefferson Rd or via East River Rd. The building is Student Innovation Hall (CSI on the map) and the parking lot is Lot S. Walk towards the buildings and walk through the Global Village Quad (beautiful outdoor seating area).  You will see a round, glass shaped building with vertical MAGIC Center banners - that’s us! Walk up the stairs, through the door and take your immediate (2 more steps) right through another glass door and you are there!

http://maps.rit.edu/

Special thanks to MAGIC for hosting us!
https://www.facebook.com/ritmagic/

MARKETING
Join us in a discussion on marketing led by John Scalzo. John has been a member of the gaming press for over 15 years and is editor-in-chief over at warpzoned.com

6:00 - 6:15: Arrivals and settling in and chattin'

7:15 - 8:00: Sharing/update on projects
8:00 - 9:00: Hangin!
name: Rochester Game Dev Meetup #7

description:
Starting with this February, we will have an informal meetup on the 3rd Saturday of every month. This meetup is intended to be more of a social gathering compared to the "workshop and presentation" format of the other meetup. 

For this month we'll meetup at The Playhouse // Swillburger. This is the newly opened bar, burger joint, and arcade that strikes me as the perfect location for our meetup. Come hang out, play some pinball, and maybe a couple of us will work our way through Gauntlet Legends.
name: Rochester Game Dev Meetup: Bits and Brews!

description:
// FEBRUARY WORKSHOP //

GAMEBOY MUSIC WITH LITTLE SOUND DJ (LSDJ)
Learn how to make music using LSDJ on the Nintendo Game Boy. An excellent program for both seasoned and non-musicians, LSDJ is an easy and fun way to make tracks for your games. 

If you'd like to follow along, download LSDJ prior to the meetup. A Game Boy is not required as the ROM will run with an emulator. Get LSDJ here: http://www.littlesounddj.com/lsd/

ABOUT THE INSTRUCTOR
As co-founder of Rochester Chip, Nick Maynard set up over three dozen monthly events, including concerts, film screenings, and workshops, all dedicated to artists making music with retro video game hardware. In 2012 and 2013, he was the main organizer of the Rochester Chip Festival which featured chiptune performers and visual artists from across the country. As a member of the local chiptune band Revengineers, Nick performed at Magfest and the 8static Festival in Philadelphia. He currently performs and releases music under the name Little Paw.

// MEETING ITINERARY //
6:00 - 6:15: Arrivals and settling in and chattin'
6:15 - 6:30: Announcements
6:30 - 7:15: Workshop 
7:15 - 8:00: Sharing/update on projects
8:00 - 9:00: Hangin!
name: Rochester Game Dev Meetup #6

description:
Starting 2016 strong!

// WORKSHOP SERIES //
Over the next couple of meetups, we will be walking through the process of making a game via condensed workshops. From prototyping to marketing, we'll cover the basics to get everyone up and running.

// JANUARY WORKSHOPS //
ZERO TO HERO!
Utilizing GameMaker Studio, see how a basic game prototype is put together. Prototyping can be thought of as "sketching" or "thumbnailing" ideas before actually starting a full project. It's a great way to see how and if an idea works.

LEVEL DESIGN
We will discuss and demo 2 styles of level design. Getting functional and fun levels can be a daunting task and our aim is to lead a solid discussion on practices that will streamline your efforts.

// MEETING ITINERARY //
6:00 - 6:15: Arrivals and settling in and chattin'
6:15 - 6:30: Announcements
6:30 - 7:00: Workshop I
7:00 - 7:30: Workshop II
7:00 - 8:00: Sharing/update on projects
8:00 - 9:00: Hangin!
name: Rochester Game Dev Meetup #5

description:
November's meetup at the Irondequoit Library worked so well that we're doing it again!

// GUEST SPEAKERS //

Adventure Guild - https://www.facebook.com/AdventureGuildGame/

Buffalo Game Space - https://www.facebook.com/buffalogamespace/

I plan to start the meeting closer to 6 this time in order to have more time at the backend of the meetup. 

See you then!
name: Rochester Game Dev Meetup #4

description:
Our third meetup!

We will be meeting in room 115. They can direct you at the information desk.

We'll be doing things slightly different this time: At 6:30 I'd like to do a round of introductions and then a brief "show and tell" of projects people are working on or have completed. We'll have a projector hookup which will make this a lot easier. No pressure if you don't have anything!

After that, the meetup will be opened up for general discussion as it has been in the past. 

Hope you can make it!
name: Rochester Game Dev Meetup #3

description:
Our second meetup!

This time we're going to try Boulder Coffee on Alexander St. for our venue and see how it goes. We'll plan to start around 6pm.
name: Rochester Game Dev Meetup #2

Plan to show up at Lovin' Cup at 6 pm. We'll do some quick introductions, discuss our projects, and go from there.
